articles.title: mODa13
articles.contents:
Past mODa workshops:
mODa 1: Eisenach, former GDR, 1987
mODa 2: St. Kyrik, Bulgaria, 1990
mODa 3: Peterhof, Russia, 1992
mODa 4: Spetses, Greece, 1995
mODa 5: Luminy, France, 1998
mODa 6: Puchberg/Schneeberg, Austria, 2001
mODa 7: Heeze, The Netherlands, 2004
mODa 8: Almagro, Spain, 2007
mODa 9: Bertinoro, Italy, 2010
mODa 10: Łagów Lubuski, Poland, 2013
mODa 11: Hamminkeln-Dingden, Germany, 2016
mODa 12: Smolenice, Solvakia, 2019

articles.title: mODa13
articles.contents:
The scientific workshops on model-oriented data analysis and optimum design (mODa) provide a high-level international forum for researchers, professionals and practitioners to present and discuss recent advances, new techniques and applications in the field of optimum experimental design. In addition, a primary aim is to provide young researchers an opportunity to establish personal contacts with leading specialists in the field. Its specificity is that the participation is by invitation of the board only.

mODa is (generally) organized every three years, with the previous mODa12 held in Smolenice, Slovakia. After a short Covid-induced delay, the 13th edition of the workshop series will be held in Southampton, UK, 9-14 July 2023.
Supported by:

articles.title: mODa13
articles.contents:
Accomodation
Accomodation for the workshop is in single ensuite rooms in Chamberlain Hall.



Check-in on Sunday 9 July: if you arrive between 15.00 and 19.00, you can pick up your room key from the Post Room in the main entrance to Chamberlain Hall (B block).
If you arrive after 19.00 on Sunday, you will need to pick up your key from the 24 hour reception in the Glen Eyre Halls complex (across the road from Chamberlain, in J block).



Check-in on other days: is available from 15.00. Please collect your key from the Glen Eyre reception.
Chamberlain is about a 10 minute walk from the workshop venue, Building 100 on Highfield Campus.


The U2 bus runs between Chamberlain Hall and Highfield Campus, and stops adjacent to Building 100. Out of term (which we very much are), the first U2C bus leaves Chamberlain at 07.25 (perfect for breakfast), then at 08.30 and then every 30 minutes (until 18.00). Returning, the U2B bus is also every 30 minutes, at 20 and 50 minutes past the hour until 17.50. There are then further buses at 18.50 and 19.50 (unfortunately, there isn’t a bus after dinner).
The bus journey takes about 15 minutes, due to roadworks currently underway at the junction of Glen Eyre and Burgess Roads. Note that the U2B bus back to Chamberlain takes a more scenic route.
Workshop venue
The workshop will be held on Level 4 of Building 100 (the Centenary Building) on Highfield Campus. Talks will be held in Lecture Room B (4011), with the Seminar room (4013) used for refreshments and the Tuesday poster display.
Building 100 closes each day at 18.00.



Breakfast, lunch and dinner
Please bring your workshop badge to all meals.
Breakfast will be in the Piazza (Building 42, Students Union) between 07.30 and 08.30 each day (for residents only).
Lunch will also be in the Piazza between 12.30 and 13.30 each day, with the exception of Wednesday when a packed lunch will be provided for the excursion to Winchester.


Dinner will be in the Terrace Restaurant (Building 38) on Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday between 19.30 and 20.15.


Workshop reception and dinner on Thursday will be held in the Harley Suite (Building 38) between 19.30 and 22.00.
Welcome reception and BBQ on Sunday will be held in Glen Eyre Hall, on the main quad. Glen Eyre is directly across the road from Chamberlain - cross the road, and follow the signs to reception. You should then spot the BBQ on the quad.
After dinner the Bridge Bar (Building 42 Students Union) will be open each day (Monday - Thursday). Other local pubs include the Crown Inn and the Brewhouse and Kitchen.




Additional information
Wifi is available on Campus and at Chamberlain Hall - Eduroam or the Guest network.
Highfield Campus is adjacent to Southampton Common, 365 acres of parkland ideal for walking or the traditional mODa football game.
Avenue Campus (a 15 minute walk from Building 100) has tennis courts that will probably not be too busy out of term.


Radio Taxis is a reliable local taxi company. Uber also operates in Southampton.

articles.title: mODa13
articles.contents:
The 13th mODa workshop will be hosted by the Southampton Statistical Sciences Research Institute (S3RI) at the University of Southampton Highfield Campus.



There has been an institution of higher education (the Hartley Institute) in Southampton since 1862, with a University College at the main Highfield Campus since 1919. The University gained it’s Royal Charter in 1952. S3RI was formed in 2003 to synergise the research of statisticians across the Mathematical, Social and Health Sciences, and Medicine. It will be celebrating its 20th anniversary when mODa13 is held.
The scientific sessions of mODa will be held in Building 100 (the Centenary Building), opened in 2019 to celebrate 100 years of higher education on the Highfield Campus. Accommodation will be in Chamberlain Halls.

articles.title: mODa13
articles.contents: Workshop participants are encouraged to submit research based on their presentations for publication in the mODa proceedings, a special issue of Statistical Papers. When submitting to the journal, please select article type as “S.I. : MODA13”. The special issue is edited by Dave Woods, Stefanie Biedermann and Chiara Tommasi.

articles.title: mODa13
articles.contents:
An outline schedule for the workshop is given below. A full programme is available here.
The workshop will start with registration and a welcome reception/bbq on Sunday evening (9 July; 18.00 - 20.00 on the main quad at Glen Eyre Hall, directly across the road from Chamberlain).
Talks all have 22.5 minute slots, and should be prepared to leave a little time for questions.
Posters will be displayed on Tuesday 11 July, and should be put up before the start of the workshop that day and taken down at the end of the day. They will be displyed on boards which are 1200mm x 1200mm in size.

articles.title: mODa13
articles.contents: Details about registration have been circulated via email.

articles.title: mODa13
articles.contents:
Workshop:
Pre-registration: March 2023 (participants will be contacted by email)
Workshop fee payment and abstract submission: 30 May
mODa13: 9-14 July 2023
Special issue:
Full paper submission deadline: 31 December 2022
Deadline for first reviews: 31 January 2023
Acceptance notification: 10 March 2023
Camera-ready versions: 17 March 2023

articles.title: mODa13
articles.contents:
Participants should travel to Chamberlain Hall for accomodation check-in and, on Sunday evening (9 July), workshop registration and the welcome reception.


Train
The closest station is Southampton Airport Parkway which is on the mainline from London. If you are arriving via Gatwick, there are services instead into Southampton Central. From either station, you can get the U1 bus to Highfield Campus (U1C from Parkway, U1A from Central), which is a short walk to Chamberlain Hall. From Southampton Central, you can get the U2B bus direct to Chamberlain. Taxis are also available from both stations (there tend to be more at Central).
As there is a direct bus from Central Station to Chamberlain (and more taxis), you may find it easier to alight there.
Airports
From London Heathrow, the most convenient connection to Southampton is via the National Express Coach. Direct coaches take about two hours and stop on Burgess Road next to Highfield Campus. From London Gatwick, there are Southern Railway services to Southampton Central (see above). Please be aware that engineering work quite often takes places on a Sunday and may disrupt your journey.
Southampton Airport is situated on the edge of the city, and connected to Highfield Campus by the U1C bus or via taxis (which must be booked at the desk inside the terminal). It has flights from many major UK cities, Amsterdam and Paris.
